consideration.definition: [i][n.][/i] the process of giving careful thought to something; a discussion of a topic (as in a meeting); kind and considerate regard for others

contradiction.definition: [i][n.][/i] opposition between two conflicting forces or ideas; (logic) a statement that is necessarily false; the speech act of contradicting someone

counterattack.definition:
[i][v.][/i] make a counterattack
[i][n.][/i] (chess) an attack that is intended to counter the opponent's advantage in another part of the board

determination.definition: [i][n.][/i] the act of determining the properties of something, usually by research or calculation; the quality of being determined to do or achieve something; firmness of purpose; deciding or controlling something's outcome or nature

differentiate.definition: [i][v.][/i] calculate a derivative; take the derivative; become different during development; become distinct and acquire a different character

distinguished.definition: [i][adj.][/i] (used of persons) standing above others in character or attainment or reputation; used of a person's appearance or behavior; befitting an eminent person

environmental.definition: [i][adj.][/i] of or relating to the external conditions or surroundings; concerned with the ecological effects of altering the environment

extraordinary.definition: [i][adj.][/i] beyond what is ordinary or usual; highly unusual or exceptional or remarkable; far more than usual or expected; (of an official) serving an unusual or special function in addition to those of the regular officials

inappropriate.definition: [i][adj.][/i] not suitable for a particular occasion etc; not in keeping with what is correct or proper

industrialize.definition: [i][v.][/i] organize (the production of something) into an industry; develop industry; become industrial

institutional.definition: [i][adj.][/i] relating to or constituting or involving an institution; organized as or forming an institution

investigation.definition: [i][n.][/i] the work of inquiring into something thoroughly and systematically

irresponsible.definition: [i][adj.][/i] showing lack of care for consequences

justification.definition: [i][n.][/i] something (such as a fact or circumstance) that shows an action to be reasonable or necessary; a statement in explanation of some action or belief; the act of defending or explaining or making excuses for by reasoning

manifestation.definition: [i][n.][/i] a clear appearance; a manifest indication of the existence or presence or nature of some person or thing

miscellaneous.definition: [i][adj.][/i] Consisting of a variety of ingredients or parts; Having diverse characteristics, abilities or appearances

misunderstand.definition: [i][v.][/i] To understand incorrectly, while believing one has understood correctly

modernization.definition: [i][n.][/i] making modern in appearance or behavior; a modernized version (as of a play)

philosophical.definition: [i][adj.][/i] characterized by the attitude of a philosopher; meeting trouble with level-headed detachment

physiological.definition: [i][adj.][/i] of or relating to the biological study of physiology

preoccupation.definition: [i][n.][/i] an idea that preoccupies the mind and holds the attention; the mental state of being preoccupied by something

psychological.definition: [i][adj.][/i] mental or emotional as opposed to physical in nature; of or relating to or determined by psychology

questionnaire.definition: [i][n.][/i] a form containing a set of questions; submitted to people to gain statistical information

revolutionary.definition: [i][adj.][/i] markedly new or introducing radical change; relating to or having the nature of a revolution; advocating or engaged in revolution

superstitious.definition: [i][adj.][/i] showing ignorance of the laws of nature and faith in magic or chance

technological.definition: [i][adj.][/i] based in scientific and industrial progress

uncomfortable.definition: [i][adj.][/i] conducive to or feeling mental discomfort; providing or experiencing physical discomfort

undergraduate.definition: [i][n.][/i] a university student who has not yet received a first degree

unpredictable.definition: [i][adj.][/i] not capable of being foretold; unknown in advance

capitalization.definition: [i][n.][/i] writing in capital letters; an estimation of the value of a business; the act of capitalizing on an opportunity

classification.definition: [i][n.][/i] a group of people or things arranged by class or category; the basic cognitive process of arranging into classes or categories; restriction imposed by the government on documents or weapons that are available only to certain authorized people

transportation.definition: [i][n.][/i] the act of moving something from one location to another; the commercial enterprise of moving goods and materials

characteristic.definition:
[i][n.][/i] a distinguishing quality; the integer part (positive or negative) of the representation of a logarithm; in the expression log 643 = 2.808 the characteristic is 2; any measurable property of a device measured under closely specified conditions
[i][adj.][/i] typical or distinctive

correspondence.definition: [i][n.][/i] communication by the exchange of letters

administration.definition: [i][n.][/i] a method of tending to or managing the affairs of a some group of people (especially the group's business affairs); the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something; the act of administering medication

congratulation.definition: [i][n.][/i] the act of acknowledging that someone has an occasion for celebration; (usually plural) an expression of pleasure at the success or good fortune of another

disappointment.definition: [i][n.][/i] a feeling of dissatisfaction that results when your expectations are not realized; an act (or failure to act) that disappoints someone

discouragement.definition: [i][n.][/i] the feeling of despair in the face of obstacles; the expression of opposition and disapproval; the act of discouraging

systematically.definition: [i][adv.][/i] in a systematic or consistent manner

reorganization.definition: [i][n.][/i] the imposition of a new organization; organizing differently (often involving extensive and drastic changes); an extensive alteration of the structure of a corporation or government

administrative.definition: [i][adj.][/i] of or relating to or responsible for administration

comprehensible.definition: [i][adj.][/i] capable of being comprehended or understood

constitutional.definition: [i][adj.][/i] of benefit to or intended to benefit your physical makeup; sanctioned by or consistent with or operating under the law determining the fundamental political principles of a government

discrimination.definition: [i][n.][/i] unfair treatment of a person or group on the basis of prejudice; the cognitive process whereby two or more stimuli are distinguished

identification.definition: [i][n.][/i] evidence of identity; something that identifies a person or thing; the condition of having the identity (of a person or object) established; the attribution to yourself (consciously or unconsciously) of the characteristics of another person (or group of persons)

interpretation.definition: [i][n.][/i] a mental representation of the meaning or significance of something; an explanation that results from interpreting something; an explanation of something that is not immediately obvious

reconstruction.definition: [i][n.][/i] the period after the American Civil War when the southern states were reorganized and reintegrated into the Union; 1865-1877; the activity of constructing something again; an interpretation formed by piecing together bits of evidence

rehabilitation.definition: [i][n.][/i] the restoration of someone to a useful place in society; vindication of a person's character and the re-establishment of that person's reputation; the treatment of physical disabilities by massage and electrotherapy and exercises

representation.definition: [i][n.][/i] a presentation to the mind in the form of an idea or image; a creation that is a visual or tangible rendering of someone or something; the act of representing; standing in for someone or some group and speaking with authority in their behalf

representative.definition: [i][adj.][/i] serving to represent or typify; standing for something else; being or characteristic of government by representation in which citizens exercise power through elected officers and representatives

responsibility.definition: [i][n.][/i] a form of trustworthiness; the trait of being answerable to someone for something or being responsible for one's conduct

superintendent.definition: [i][n.][/i] a caretaker for an apartment house; represents the owner as janitor and rent collector

transformation.definition: [i][n.][/i] a qualitative change; (mathematics) a function that changes the position or direction of the axes of a coordinate system; a rule describing the conversion of one syntactic structure into another related syntactic structure

understandable.definition: [i][adj.][/i] Capable of being understood; comprehensible; Capable of being accepted or excused under the circumstances

distinguishable.definition: [i][adj.][/i] capable of being perceived as different or distinct

resourcefulness.definition: [i][n.][/i] the quality of being able to cope with a difficult situation

dissatisfaction.definition: [i][n.][/i] the feeling of being displeased and discontent

experimentation.definition: [i][n.][/i] The act of experimenting; practice by experiment; A set of actions and observations, performed to verify or falsify a hypothesis or to research a causal relationship between phenomena

extracurricular.definition: [i][adj.][/i] outside the regular academic curriculum; outside the regular duties of your job or profession

interchangeable.definition: [i][adj.][/i] (mathematics, logic) such that the arguments or roles can be interchanged

misunderstanding.definition: [i][v.][/i] To understand incorrectly, while believing one has understood correctly
